meanings.definition: Occurring or existing after the era of widespread literacy.
meanings.sent1: The postliterate society embraced new forms of communication.
meanings.sent2: In the postliterate world, images and symbols became more important than text.
meanings.sent3: The postliterate children found joy in exploring visual storytelling.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a postliterate landscape, filled with colors and shapes instead of words.
meanings.sent5: The postliterate era brought forth a revolution in how information was shared.

meanings.definition: A person or society that has moved beyond traditional forms of reading and writing.
meanings.sent1: The postliterate was fascinated by interactive media.
meanings.sent2: Postliterates often prefer digital content over printed books.
meanings.sent3: The postliterate in the village amazed everyone with their ability to navigate technology.
meanings.sent4: She was a postliterate in a world of ancient scrolls and quills.
meanings.sent5: The postliterate community thrived on visual communication and multimedia.
